frontmatter.title: Polymorphism (OOP)
frontmatter.description: Polymorphism is one of the most important concepts of object oriented programming. It comes from two Greek words, Poly and Morph. Poly means Many and Morph means Form.

frontmatter.title: Accounts Receivable
frontmatter.description: Receivable is a due from any individual or company to other individual or company. Accounts receivable is a due that generated by selling products or services to individual or company.

frontmatter.title: Double Entry Accounting System
frontmatter.description: Double entry accounting system is the scientific method of recording business transactions. It has been first  documented by Luca Pacioli in 1494.

frontmatter.title: Single Entry Accounting System
frontmatter.description: A single entry bookkeeping is an accounting system that records only one entry for a transaction to the accounting records.

frontmatter.title: Layered Architecture
frontmatter.description: The most common architectural pattern is the Layered Architectural pattern. It is the most widely used architectural pattern in today industry. This pattern is easy to implement and it has similarity with the organizational architecture.

frontmatter.title: GST - Input Tax Credit
frontmatter.description: There are two types of transactions happen in any business, inward supply and outward supply. Business procure raw materials, semi-finished or finished goods which is inward supply and after making the product they sale it, which is outward supply.
